text: A quick question, how can I generate the jason file for this old method template/module

One option is that you can download the template in json format with <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#fetch|HubSpot CLI tool>

```hs fetch --account=<name> /path/to/template/Home.template.json```

Yes you will get json. Just notice that naming is a bit different than html files.

If template name is "Home" then file name is `Home.template.json`.

I’ve been using it since it was documented!! And then when it was the most downloaded module from marketplace when they took the functionality away.

As you can probably tell from my screenshot I have an advanced styling part to all my modules where someone can add custom CSS that is scoped to the module. It comes in very handy when you just need a little tweak for this one instance of the module.

I can just use the text field but the HTML one is so much nicer

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report.a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

As of 2023, is it the case that we can't use Webhooks with a Private App and also that we can't create a Public App through a Developer Account? I was hoping for my application to be notified when a particular property is changed via webhooks but it appears the only solution now is to make a periodic API call.
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1678797302189219>
You can create a public app through a developer account, but you are correct in saying you can't do webhooks through private apps (yet)

I've been looking at the following documentation about creating a public app:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-app>

However, I don't see an option for me to create a public app through my developer account. I don't have the same navigation with "Home", "Apps" etc
It's probably not a developer account then...
You might have a dev test account, but not a developer account
You can signup for a developer accuont here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/signup-HubSpot/developers?_ga=2.39153443.1802613489.1576611619-500942594.1573763828&step=existing_user>
I'm fairly sure it is a developer account. See area highlighted in red in image attached
Dev test accounts say the same thing...
I know with a 100% confidence that if you don't have the create/manage apps on that account, but instead have the normal HubSpot looking account that's a test account and not a developer app account
You can use the above link to signup for a developer app account though
Ok thanks. I created a developer account from the link you provided and I see a different navigation now.
Awesome, nice work!

I'm trying to work out the recommended way of implementing a page picker type field. We have a collection of case study pages and want to feature some of them on the homepage in a grid

I can add a repeater field to the homepage with type Page to allow the editor to choose the ones they want, but ideally I want to set custom properties to those pages that are used in the grid (preview image, background hover color etc)

- Is there a way of limiting the page field to only allow picking pages that use a certain template?
- What is the best way of adding the custom fields to those pages? They're just properties that would only be used on the preview case study grid, not part of the content of the page itself.

I could create a hubdb table to hold the extra information and then put the link to the full page in the table, but I'd then be editing content in two places, and have to pull out the data from both the page and hubdb to render the feature grid.

Is there a general approach for where you want to feature content from other pages on a different page?

Hey All,

Is it possible to to create/attach an ical file to an automated marketing email? We're looking to see how we can create an "add to calendar" button in an email that is custom for each customer. The data for the date/time for the event is coming in from SAP.
I use <http://Addevent.com|Addevent.com> for this

Hi all, I'm creating a module that have a graphql file associated with it, the thing is that the graphql have two querys and I'm not being able to access the information of the second one. For the first one I just use module.data_query.data, but what about the second one? is it possible to have two querys in a single file? thanks
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CFPRTEGTX/p1678817733114019>

Hi all, does anyone know if increasing the HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header's max-age value from 6 weeks to 6 months or 1 year can have potential risks on site's metrics (e.g. traffic, revenue) or broken pages?

Hi everyone,
Just a general question, and I've been looping about this with not much definite answer.
• Should we need Ops Hub if we have a client who wants an Integration project with Custom APIs?
• What plan is the least when the client just wants basic integration without custom API?
• What plan is the least when the client wants custom code workflow?
Thanks
